intro.description:
OpenOffice.org can be used as well as a server. Creating clients connecting to it is not an easy task for beginners and the informations are split all over the web.
Follow the next steps to create a new C++ UNO Client really quickly.

item.title: Create the C++ UNO Client
item.description:
Create a new project of type C++ UNO Client application.
Configure the OpenOffice.org instance and SDK used to build to program and configure the OpenOffice.org connection.

item.title: Write the client code
item.description: Replace the TODO comment by the code using the UNO connection to OpenOffice.org.

item.title: Create a launch configuration
item.description:
Create a C++ Application run configuration.
Don't forget to add the LD_LIBRARY_PATH or PATH in the environment variables and set it to the path to the ure/lib folder in the OpenOffice.org installation.

item.title: Start OpenOffice.org
item.description:
OpenOffice.org needs to be started with the following parameter depending on your connection configuration:
Pipe connection:
-accept="pipe,name=pipename;urp;StarOffice.ServiceManager"
Socket connection:
-accept="socket,host=host,port=port;urp;StarOffice.ServiceManager"

item.title: Run the client
item.description: Everything is done! Now run the new UNO client program.
